name: Customer Greeter and bag check module
description: An LMS training module that must be completed prior to being rostered in the Customer Greeter role, as part of the Minimum Training Standards.
troubleshooting: Sometimes, other customers will take offence to seeing a mother breastfeeding or expressing in one of our stores.

If you receive a complaint from a customer you may advise them that this is a women's right under Australian Federal Law. If you are uncomfortable, unsure, or if the complaint escalates seek help from your Store Manager.
constraints: In Australian Federal Law, breastfeeding is a right, not a privilege.
Under the federal Sex Discrimination Act 1984 it is illegal in Australia to discriminate against a person either directly or indirectly on the grounds of breastfeeding.
This means, a woman has the right to breastfeed, or express milk, anywhere she chooses. This includes our stores.
Customer Greeter and bag check module completed in LMS prior to being rostered.
When a Customer Greeter is on a break, the replacement Customer Greeter must have completed the minimum training standards listed below.
bestPractice: Seek help from your Store Manager if you are unsure.
No one should ever be asked by a team member to cover themselves or stop breastfeeding or expressing anywhere in our stores.
This includes in fitting rooms or on the shop floor.
